Description: Autoscaling group of Docker engines in dual AZ VPC with two NAT nodes in an active/active configuration. After successfully launching this CloudFormation stack, you will have 4 subnets in 2 AZs (a pair of public/private subnets in each AZ), a jump box, two NAT instances routing outbound traffic for their respective private subnets.  The NAT instances will automatically monitor each other and fix outbound routing problems if the other instance is unavailable.  The Docker engine autoscaling group will deploy to the private subnets.

App.ConstraintDescription: Can contain only alphanumeric characters, spaces, dashes and underscores.

Group.Description: Group responsible for this ecosystem of services
Group.ConstraintDescription: Can contain only alphanumeric characters, spaces, dashes and underscores.

Owner.Description: Individual responsible for this ecosystem of services
Owner.ConstraintDescription: Can contain only alphanumeric characters, spaces, dashes and underscores.

Environment.Description: Description of deployment environment, e. g., test or production
Environment.ConstraintDescription: Can contain only alphanumeric characters, spaces, dashes and underscores.

KeepAlive.Description: Boolean to indicate whether to allow resource to be kept alive during nightly reaping

CostCenter.Description: Cost center to be charged for this ecosystem of services

KeyName.Description: Name of an existing EC2 KeyPair to enable SSH access to the instances
KeyName.ConstraintDescription: Value must be a valid AWS key pair name in your account.

VpcCidr.Description: CIDR address range for the VPC to be created

PublicSubnet1.Description: CIDR address range for the public subnet to be created in the first AZ

PrivateSubnet1.Description: CIDR address range for the private subnet to be created in the first AZ

PublicSubnet2.Description: CIDR address range for the public subnet to be created in the second AZ

PrivateSubnet2.Description: CIDR address range for the private subnet to be created in the second AZ

JumpInstanceType.Description: Instance type for public subnet jump nodes
JumpInstanceType.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid EC2 instance type.

NATInstanceType.Description: Instance type for public subnet NAT nodes
NATInstanceType.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid EC2 instance type.

NumberOfPings.Description: The number of times the health check will ping the alternate NAT node

PingTimeout.Description: The number of seconds to wait for each ping response before determining that the ping has failed

WaitBetweenPings.Description: The number of seconds to wait between health checks

WaitForInstanceStop.Description: The number of seconds to wait for alternate NAT Node to stop before attempting to stop it again

WaitForInstanceStart.Description: The number of seconds to wait for alternate NAT node to restart before resuming health checks again

DockerInstanceType.Description: EC2 instance type for the Docker autoscaling group
DockerInstanceType.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid EC2 HVM instance type.

AutoScaleCooldown.Description: Time in seconds between autoscaling events

DiscoveryURL.Description: An unique etcd cluster discovery URL. Grab a new token from https://discovery.etcd.io/new

AdvertisedIPAddress.Description: Use 'private' if your etcd cluster is within one region or 'public' if it spans regions or cloud providers.

AllowSSHFrom.Description: The net block (CIDR) that SSH is available to.

Properties.GroupDescription: Rules for allowing access to public subnet nodes
